question: In a certain code language, FEED is written as 24, and ACCOUNT is written as 42. How will PIZZA be written in that language?
solution:
(c) Logic :- (Number of letters) 6
FEED :- (4)6 = 24
ACCOUNT :- (7)6 = 42
Similarly,
PIZZA :- (5)6 = 30

question:
Which two numbers (not individual digits) should be interchanged to make the given equation correct?
[(39 - 3) 6] + 11 2 - 4 5 = 13
solution:
(d) Given :- [(39 - 3) 6] + 11 2 - 4 5 = 13
After checking all the options one by one, option (d) satisfies. After interchanging 3 and 6 we get
[(39 - 6) 3] + 11 2 - 4 5
[(33) 3] + 22 - 20
11 + 22 - 20 = 13
L.H.S. = R.H.S.

question:
11 is related to 121 following a certain logic. Following the same logic, 22 is related to 484. To which of the following is 31 related, following the same logic?
(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 Operations on 13 such as adding /deleting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed)
solution:
(a)
Logic:- (1stno.)2 = 2nd no.
(11, 121) :- (11)2 = 121
(22, 484) :- (22)2 = 484
similarly
(31, ?) :- (31)2 = 961

question: Shab-e-Barat is celebrated by which religious group?
solution: (a) Muslim. Shab-e-Barat, also known as Mid-Sha'ban, is observed on the 15th night of Sha'ban in the Islamic calendar. Festivals celebrated by : Muslim - Eid al-Fitr, Eid al-Adha etc; Buddhist - Buddha Purnima, Vesak etc; Jain - Mahavir Jayanti, Paryushana etc; Parsi - Navroz, Jamshedi Navroz etc.

question: In 2002, Zakir Hussain became the youngest percussionist to be honoured with which award?
solution: (c) Padma Bhushan. Ustad Zakir Hussain is the eldest son of tabla player Alla Rakha. His Awards: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1991), Padma Shri (1988), Padma Vibhushan (2023). He won three Grammys at the 66th Annual Grammy Awards in 2024. Indian tabla players: Pandit Shankar Ghosh, Pandit Udhai Mazumdar, Nandan Mehta, Pandit Swapan Chaudhuri, Pandit Vijay Ghate.

question: Who released the report linking alcohol consumption to an increased risk of cancer?
solution: (b) US Surgeon General Dr. Vivek Murthy released a new Surgeon Generals Advisory on Alcohol and Cancer Risk. The Surgeon Generals report notes that alcohol consumption is the third leading preventable cause of cancer in the United States, after tobacco use and obesity. The World Health Organization (WHO) was founded in 1948 and is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland.

question: In which year was the MPLADS scheme implemented?
solution: (c) 1993. Objective : The Member of Parliament Local Area Development Scheme (MPLADS) aims to empower MPs to recommend developmental projects that focus on creating durable community assets in areas such as drinking water, primary education, public health, sanitation, and road infrastructure, primarily within their constituencies. Each year, MPs receive 5 crore in two installments of 2.5 crore each. Notably, the funds allocated under MPLADS are non-lapsable.

question: Which two Indian cities have become the first to join the global list of accredited Wetland Cities under the Ramsar Convention on Wetlands in January 2025?
solution: (b) Indore and Udaipur join the list of 31 Wetland Accredited Cities in the world. Wetland City Accreditation (WCA): It is a voluntary Accreditation system that provides an opportunity for cities that value their natural or human-made wetlands to gain international recognition and positive publicity for their efforts. It was approved at Uruguay in COP12 of Ramsar Convention (2015).

question: In Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana, beneficiaries are provided with how much amount every year?
solution: (a) 6,000 - per year in three equal installments, every four months is transferred into the bank accounts of farmers families across the country through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) mode. Implemented by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare. Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana launched on 24th February, 2019.

question: Langvir Nritya is a folk dance from the state of ________
solution: (c) Uttarakhand. Langvir Nritya is a dance form practiced by only men. The dancers use a long bamboo pole. States and their Folk dances : Gujarat - Garba and Dandiya Raas. Haryana - Phalgun dance, Luur dance, Daf dance, Gugga dance, and Khoria dance. Uttar Pradesh - Charkula, Rasiya, Nautanki.

question:
Identify the sequence of implementation of the following taxes.
I.Land revenue
II.Sales tax
III.MODVAT
IV.Service tax
solution: (d) I, II, III, IV. India's tax system includes direct and indirect taxes. In 2017, the Goods and Services Tax (GST) was introduced as part of indirect taxes. Direct taxes are imposed on individuals and corporations, while indirect taxes are collected through the sale of goods and services. Key tax introductions in India include Income Tax, Gift Tax, Service Tax, Banking Transaction Tax, and GST.

question: Which state will host the Khelo India Youth Games (KIYG) and the Khelo India Para Games (KIPG) in April 2025?
solution: 34 (b) Bihar will host the prestigious Khelo India Youth Games (KIYG) and the Khelo India Para Games (KIPG) in April 2025. This follows the successful organization of the Womens Asian Champions Trophy in Rajgir, further cementing Bihars growing reputation in the sports arena.

question: In the year of the coronation of Akbar, who among the following was designated as the Wakil of the Mughal kingdom with the title of Khan-i-Khanan ?
solution: (a) Bairam Khan was Akbar's trusted advisor, mentor and guardian after Humayun's death. He was also the chief of Humayun's army and led the Mughal army in the Second War of Panipat in 1556 (between the forces of the Mughal emperor Akbar and the Hindu king Hemu). He acted as Akbar's regent from 1556 to 1560.

solution: (a) A-ii, B-i, C-iv, D-iii. Devendra Jhajharia (Paralympic javelin thrower) : Awards - Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna (2017), Padma Shri (2012), Arjuna Award (2004). Sumit Antil (javelin thrower) : Award - Khel Ratna Award (2021). Neeraj Chopra : Awards - Arjuna Award (2018), Padma Shri (2022). Shikhar Dhawan is an Indian former cricketer.

question: Ungalil Oruvan (One Among You) is the autobiography of which of the following chief ministers?
solution: (a) MK Stalin. Other Chief ministers books : Mamata Banerjee - My Unforgettable Memories, Yogi Adityanath - Hathyoga : Swaroop evam Sadhna, Arvind Kejriwal - Swaraj.

question: In a metro station, it was observed that on an average 20 people per minute were using the escalator to reach at a height of 15 metres. Calculate the power of the escalator assuming the average mass of people to be 50 kg and acceleration due to gravity to be 10 m/s2.
solution: (b) 2.5 kW. To calculate the power of the escalator : P = Wt (W is the work done, and t is the time). Given, m = 50kg (mass of one person), g = 10m/s2 (acceleration due to gravity), h =15 m (height), n = 20 people/min. Work done to lift one person is: W = mhg. Thus, the work done per minute is: 50 15 10 = 7500J. For 20 people per minute: 7500 20 = 150000J/min, 15000060 = 2500J/s = 2.5 kW. Thus, the power required is 2.5 kW.

question: Who is the chairman of the State Planning Board?
solution: (c) Chief Minister. A State Planning Board is a key advisory body responsible for drafting and monitoring state-level developmental policies and plans. It ensures effective resource allocation and alignment with national goals, focusing on sectors like poverty alleviation, education, and infrastructure. The board typically includes the Chief Minister as Chairperson, experts, and officials to guide economic and social development strategies. It collaborates with central bodies like NITI Aayog for effective planning and implementation. By evaluating ongoing programs, the board ensures sustainable growth and efficient policy execution.

question: The Sarda River rises in the ________ glacier in the Nepal Himalayas.
solution: (a) Milam. The Sharda River, a downstream tributary of the Kali (or Mahakali) River, originates in northern Uttarakhand, India, in the Great Himalayas, on the eastern slopes of the Nanda Devi massif at an elevation of 3,600 m (11,800 ft) in Pithoragarh district. It then flows along the India-Nepal border.

question: Under which of the following Acts, was Warren Hastings appointed as the Governor-General of Bengal?
solution: (a) The Regulating Act, 1773 designated the Governor of Bengal as the Governor-General of Bengal and created an Executive Council of four members to assist him. This Act also placed the Governors of Bombay and Madras under the authority of the Governor-General of Bengal. Additionally, it stipulated the establishment of a Supreme Court in Calcutta in 1774. The Government of India Act 1858 - Transferred power from the East India Company to the British Crown. The Government of India Act 1909 - It introduced a separate electorate.

question: The horizontal distance between two adjacent crests or troughs is known as the __________.
solution: (d) wave length. The wave speed (v) is defined as the distance traveled by a wave per unit time. The frequency of a wave is the total number of waves produced in a second. Wave period is the time it takes for one complete cycle of the wave to pass a certain point. Waves transport energy and the pattern of disturbance has information that propagates from one point to another.

question: The first Indian Olympic Games was hosted by which of the following cities?
solution: (a) Lahore. Dr. A. G. Noehren and Harry Crowe Buck launched the first Indian Olympic Games in Lahore in 1924 to engage youth in sports. India first participated in the Olympics in 1900, and the first modern Olympics were in Athens in 1896. The last hockey gold came in 1980. Wrestler K.D. Jadhav won India's first individual medal in 1952, and Milkha Singh was the first Indian to reach the Olympic finals in athletics.

question: The earthquakes that are generated due to the explosion of chemical or nuclear devices are known as :
solution: (b) Explosion earthquakes. An earthquake in simple words is the shaking of the earth. Tectonic earthquakes are produced by sudden movement along faults and plate boundaries. Reservoir-induced earthquakes are earthquakes caused by the physical processes that occur when large reservoirs are filled with water. Collapse earthquakes are small earthquakes in underground caverns and mines that are caused by seismic waves produced from the explosion of rock on the surface.

question: Which gas is released when you combine vinegar and baking soda in a balloon, causing it to inflate?
solution: (a) Carbon dioxide. When you combine vinegar (acetic acid) and baking soda (sodium bicarbonate), they react to produce carbon dioxide (CO2) gas. The reaction is as follows: CH3COOH + NaHCO3 CH3COONa + H2O + CO2. When you add the baking soda to the vinegar it causes a reaction. That reaction releases a gas called carbon dioxide (CO2) because the balloon forms a seal around the bottle, the gas produced cannot escape, so it fills up the balloon.

question: In Equestrian sports, ______ occurs when a horse or rider lowers an element of a jump that establishes the height of an obstacle.
solution: (a) knockdown. Penalties: A knockdown usually results in 4 penalty points. Types of Knockdowns: Knockdowns can occur due to various reasons, including the horse's mistake, rider error, or a combination of both. Impact on Score: Accumulating penalty points can significantly affect a rider's overall score and ranking in the competition.

question: In 1928, who among the following wrote the Congress Partys Nehru Report, a future constitution for independent India, based on the granting of dominion status?
solution: (a) Motilal Nehru. Recommendations of the Nehru Report: Dominion status, Rejection of separate electorates, Linguistic provinces, Nineteen fundamental rights including equal rights for women, Full protection of the cultural and religious interests of Muslims, Complete dissociation of religion from the state. Other members of the committee were Tej Bahadur Sapru, Ali Imam, M.S. Aney, Mangal Singh, Sohaib Qureshi, G.R. Pradhan and Subhash Chandra Bose.

question: Select the imbalanced chemical equation from the following.
solution: (b) 6 HClO4 + P4O10 4H3PO4 + 6 Cl2O7. A chemical equation is balanced when the number of atoms of each element is equal on both sides, achieved by adjusting coefficients. This ensures the law of conservation of mass, which states that atoms are rearranged to form products, but the total mass remains constant in a chemical reaction.

question: The Universal Adult Franchise in Indian Constitution is applicable to Indian Citizens from the age of _______________.
solution: (a) 18 years. Universal adult franchise allows all adults to vote. Article 325 of the Constitution ensures universal suffrage, prohibiting exclusion from electoral rolls based on religion, race, caste, or sex. Under this principle, all citizens aged 18 and above, regardless of social or economic background, have the right to vote. The 61st Amendment Act of 1988 lowered the voting age from 21 to 18, receiving presidential assent on 28th March 1989 from President R. Venkataraman.

question: Digestion of food is an important function of the animal body. In animals like lions, cows, humans, etc., the process involves use of various organs starting from the mouth and ending with the anus. The longest part of this canal is known as the ________.
solution: (d) Small intestine. It is a 20-foot tube in the digestive system, breaks down food and absorbs nutrients. It has three parts: the duodenum, jejunum, and ileum, and helps digest food from the stomach while absorbing vitamins, minerals, carbs, fats, proteins, and water. The large intestine, about 5 feet long, is wider but shorter than the small intestine. The esophagus in adults is typically 10 - 13 inches long and about inch in diameter at its narrowest point.

question: The value of 72  8  210  15  5 + 2  5 is:

After working for 8 days, Rakhi finds that only 10 percent of the work is completed. She employs Poonam who is 20 percent more efficient than Rakhi. How many more days will they together take to complete the remaining work?
solution:
(b)
Time taken by Rakhi to complete the whole work = 8 10 = 80 days
Ratio of efficiency of Poonam and Rakhi= 6 : 5
Total work = 5 80 = 400 unit
Remaining work = 400 90% = 360 unit
Time taken by both to complete the remaining work = 3606+5 = 36011days

question: Which of the following is NOT a correct formula?
solution:
(b)
Let A = 45
(a)
LHS = Cos2A Cot2A
= Cos245 Cot245 = 12
RHS = Cot2A - Cos2A
= Cot245 - Cos245 = 1 - 12 = 12
(b) 1+Tan2ATan2A = sin2A
LHS = 1+Tan2ATan2A
= 1+11 = 2
RHS = sin2A = sin245 = 12
Hence LHS RHS
1+Tan2ATan2A = sin2A (not the correct formula).

question: Which of the following numbers is not divisible by 11 ?
solution:
(a) After checking all options one by one, only option (a) satisfied.
The given number can only be completely divided by 11 if the difference of the sum of digits at odd position and sum of digits at even position in a number is 0 or 11.

question: Rajesh is playing with a football having diameter of 28 cm. He wants to get a photo of his favourite player painted on the entire ball. The painter charges 2/cm. What will be the cost (in ) of painting the ball (take =227)?
solution:
(a) Given : diameter of sphere = 28 cm then radius = 14 cm
Surface area of sphere = 4r2
Surface area of sphere = 4 227 14 14
= 2464 cm2
Now,
Cost of painting the ball = 2464 2 = 4928

question: In a Panchayat election, three contestants - A, B, and C- are contesting. 75% of the total population of 8000 cast their votes. There were no invalid or NOTA votes in the election. A got the least votes, with only 300 votes. B got 66% of the total votes and won the election. How many votes did B get?
solution:
(d)
No. of voters who cast their votes = 8000 75% = 6000
No. of votes received by B = 6000 66% = 3960

question: The average of five numbers is 32. If one number is removed, then the average becomes 28. What is the removed number ?
solution:
(a)
Removed no. = 32 + (32 - 28) 4 = 32 + 16 = 48
Alternate :
Removed number = 32 5 - 28 4 = 160 - 112 = 48

question: PQR is a triangle. MN is a line segment intersecting PQ in M and PR in N such that MN QR and divides PQR into two parts, which are equal in area. What is the ratio of MQ to PQ?
solution:
(d)

PMN PQR (by similar triangle rule))
PM2PQ2 = ar(PMN)ar(PQR) = 12
PMPQ = 12
PQ-QMPQ = 12
1 - MQPQ = 12
MQPQ = 1 - 12= 2-12

question: If x y = 25 and xy = 444, compute the value of x3 y3
solution:
(a)
x - y = 25
On squaring both side
(x - y)2 = 625
x2 + y2 - 2xy = 625
x2 + y2 - 2 444 = 625 (given xy = 444)
x2 + y2 = 625 + 888 = 1513
x3 y3 = (x-y) (x2+y2+xy)
= (25) (1513 + 444)
= 25 1957 = 48,925

question: The ratio of acid and water in a mixture is 5 : 3. If 12 liters of water is added to it, the ratio of acid and water becomes 5 : 6. What is the amount of acid in this mixture?
solution:
(d)
Let the quantity of acid and water be 5a and 3a respectively.
According to question,
5a3a+12 = 56
30a = 15a + 60
a = 4.
Therefore, quantity of acid = 5a = 20 liter

question: One pipe can fill a tank 6 times faster than another pipe. If both the pipes together can fill the tank in 40 minutes, then in how many minutes will the slower pipe alone be able to fill the tank?
solution:
(d)
Ratio pipe1 : pipe2
Efficiency 1 : 6
Capacity of tank = 40 7 = 280 min
Time taken by slower pipe to fill the tank = 2801 = 280 min

question: 1,380 has to be paid after 4 years. If four equal installments are required with a simple interest of 10% on each installment, then what is the value of each installment?

(c)
Here,
P = 1380
R = 10 %
T = 4 years
Installment = 100 P 100 t + r t (t-1)2
I = 10013801004+104(4-1)2
I = 138000400+10432
I = 138000 400+60
I = 138000460
I= 300

question: In a circle of radius 513 cm, a chord is at a distance of 10 cm from the centre of the circle. Find the length (in cm) of the chord.
solution:
(a)

In AON,
By using pythagoras theorem,
AN2 + ON2 = AO2
(10)2 + AN2 = (513)2
100 + AN2 = 325
AN = 325-100= 225
AN = 15 cm
AN = NB = 15 cm
So, AB = 30 cm

question: The percentage profit earned by selling an article for Rs.2,100 is equal to the percentage loss incurred by selling the same article for Rs.1,460. At what price should the article be sold to make 20% profit?
solution:
(c)
Proft % = SP-CPCP 100 = 2100-CPCP 100
Loss % = CP-SPCP 100 = CP-1460CP 100
According to question,
Profit% = Loss %
2100-CPCP 100 = CP-1460CP 100
2 CP = 2100 + 1460
2 CP = 3560
CP = 1780
Now,
SP = 1780 120100= 2136

question: If the price of tea is increased by 40%, by how much percentage must the consumption of tea be decreased so as not to increase the expenditure ?
solution:
(b)
According to the question,
Ratio - initial : final
Price - 100 : 140
Consumption - 140 : 100
decrease% = 140-100140 100 = 2847%

question: A person borrowed Rs. 15000 on compound interest at the rate of 30 percent per annum. If the interest is compounded half yearly, then what will be the amount to be paid after 1 year?
solution:
(b)
Rate for half yrs = 302 = 15%
Effective CI for 1 yr = (15+15 +1515100)% = 32.25%
So, the amount to be paid after 1 yr = 132.25% of 15000 = 19,837.5

question:
Study the given table and answer the question that follows.
The given table shows the production of T-shirts by four companies i.e., C1, C2, C3 and C4 over the four years.

Which company had the maximum average production of T-shirts during these four years?


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1743652253194.png
solution:
(c)
Average of the production of T-shirts during four years are:-
For company C1 = 243+248+232+2424 = 9654= 241.25
For company C2 = 244+239+240+2444 = 9674= 241.75
For company C3 = 244+236+235+2304 = 9454= 236.25
For company C4 = 240+230+248+2424 = 9604= 240
Clearly, production of T-shirts in the four years by company C2 is maximum.

question: A shopkeeper wanted to sell 2,000 worth of products. But he had two options, giving three successive discounts of 10% each or giving a single discount of 28%. What was the difference between the two options of discounts (in rupees) ?
solution:
(b)
Net discount after three successive discount = 2000 - 2000 910 910 910 = 2000 - 1458 = 542
Discount of 28% = 2000 28100= 560
Required difference = 18

question:
Study the given table and answer the question that follows.
The table shows the number of students studying in 6 different classes of 6 different schools.

The number of students studying in class X from school P forms approximately what percentage of the total number of students studying in class X from all schools together?
https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1743652253485.png
solution:
(d)
Required % = 144910100 16%

question: If (sin x + sin y) = a and (cos x + cos y) = b, then find the value of (sin x sin y + cos x cos y).
solution:
(c)
(sin x + sin y) = a ----------------- (i)
Squaring both side,
sin2x + sin2y + 2sinxsiny = a2 ----------------- (ii)
(cos x + cos y) = b ----------------- (iii)
Squaring both side,
cos2x + cos2y + 2cosxcosy = b2 ----------------- (iv)
Adding eqn (ii) & (iv) we get ;
(sin2x + cos2x) + (sin2y + cos2y) + 2sinxsiny + 2cosxcosy = a2+ b2
1 + 1 + 2(sinxsiny + cosxcosy) = a2+ b2
2(1 + sinxsiny + cosxcosy) = a2+ b2
(1 + sinxsiny + cosxcosy) = a2+b22
sinxsiny + cosxcosy = a2+b22 - 1 = a2+b2-22

question:
Amongst the following fractions, the largest and smallest fractions, respectively, are
12,13,45,56,34
solution:
(a) LCM (2, 3, 5, 6, 4) = 60
130230 = 3060 
120320 = 2060
412512 = 4860
510610 = 5060
315415 = 4560
The largest and the smallest fraction = 56 and 13

question: The age of the older of two boys is thrice that of the younger. 9 years ago it was five times that of the younger. Find the present age of each.
solution:
(b)
Let the age of younger boy be x year
Then, age of older boy = 3x
Now, according to the question,
(3x - 9) = 5 (x - 9)
3x - 9 = 5x - 45
2x = 36
x = 18
So, the present age of each is 18 yr and 54 yr.

question: If x : 6 :: 6 : y and x : y :: y : 6, then which of the options below gives the correct values of x and y in that order?
solution:
(a) By checking option one by one we get option (a) satisfies
x : 6 :: 6 : y 66= 66 1 : 1
x : y :: y : 6 66= 66 1 : 1

question: Three students of class VII participated in a race during a school sports day. In a 1 km race, A wins the race with B by 100 m, and in a 300 m race, B beats C by 50 m. Then in the race of 1 km, with what margin will A beat C?
solution:
(d) In 1km race
A B
Distance 1000 : 900
In 300m race
B C
Distance 300 : 250
Hence , A B C
Distance 1000 : 900
3003 : 2503

Distance A B C
1000 : 900 : 750
Margin between A beat C = 1000 - 750 = 250m

question:
Identify the segment in the sentence, which contains the grammatical error.
The Prime Minister said the country was in its way toward reaching its goal of becoming the first country with women in at least 40 percent of public sector management positions.
option_1: The Prime Minister said the country was
option_2: in its way toward reaching its goal of
option_3: in at least 40 percent of public sector management positions
solution:
(b) There is a prepositional error in the given sentence. The preposition in must be replaced with on
Because "In the way" means that something is an obstacle. Or "On the way" means that something, or someone, is in the process of reaching a goal, or a destination. Hence, on its way towards is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate Synonym of the given word
Wreak
solution:
(b) Cause- a thing or person that makes something happen.
Wreak- to cause great damage or harm to somebody/something.
Fail- to not be successful in something.
Forget- to not be able to remember something.
Neglect- to give too little or no attention or care to somebody/something.

question:
Identify the best way to improve the underlined part of the given sentence. If there is no improvement required, select no improvement.
The labourers are digging borewell in the field from sunrise and will continue to do so until sunset.
solution:
(b) have been digging
The Underlined initial part of the sentence must be in the Present Perfect Continuous tense(has/have been + V-ing) as the sentence mentions the starting and the ending time (from sunrise to sunset.) Hence, have been digging is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Identify the best way to improve the underlined part of the given sentence. If there is no improvement required, select no improvement.
Some miners will have died at a blast in a coal mine in eastern Ukraine as per estimates.
solution:
(a) Have died
The given sentence is in the present perfect tense so it must have the verb in the present perfect form (has/have + V3(third form of the verb). Hence, have died(V3) is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Choose the most appropriate option to change the narration (direct/indirect) of the given sentence:
She said, Will you have time to do it ? And I said, Yes.
option_1: She asked (me) if I would have time to do it and I said that I would.
option_2: She asked that she would have time to do it and I said that I could.
option_3: She asked that I would have time to do it and I said that I would.
option_4: She asked me for time and I replied in the affirmative.
solution:
(a) She asked (me) if I would have time to do it and I said that I would.
(b) She asked that she would have time to do it and I said that I could. (Listener is missing)
(c) She asked that I would have time to do it and I said that I would. (Listener is missing)
(d) She asked me for time and I replied in the affirmative(Meaning of sentence changed)

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.
The homework must be done by you.
solution:
(d) You must do the homework. (Correct)
(a) You should have done the homework. (Incorrect Verb)
(b) You do the homework. (Modal is missing)
(c) You will do the homework. (Incorrect Modal)

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
(A) I went near the edge of the water, and I saw a black something struggling above its surface.
(B) Then it rose higher and it was the trunk of my elephant.
(C) I thought he was drowning.
(D) I was helpless because I could not jump into the water and save the four hundred pounds of him.
solution:
(c)ABCD
In the parajumble, the narrators experience is mentioned . Sentence A will be the first sentence, as it is explained that the narrator saw a black something struggling in the water. B will follow A as in B, it is given he thought it was his elephants trunk. B will be followed by C and at the end D. As it is explained he thought the elephant was drowning but he was helpless. Hence option ( c) has the correct sequence.

question: Identify the word that is misspelt.
solution:
(b) Replacable
Replaceable is the correct spelling.

question:
Identify the segment in the sentence, which contains the grammatical error.
She gave me the details of all the schools she had visited while she was on her official tour.
option_3: visited while she was on her official tour
solution: (d) No error. The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.
When pigs fly
solution:
(a) When pigs fly - something that will never happen.
E.g.- It will snow in the desert when pigs fly.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.
The painting was admired by art enthusiasts from around the world.
option_1: The painting was being admired by art enthusiasts from around the world.
option_2: Art enthusiasts from around the world admired the painting.
option_3: Art enthusiasts from around the world have admired the painting.
option_4: The painting has been admired by art enthusiasts from around the world.
solution:
(b) Art enthusiasts from around the world admired the painting. (Correct)
(a) The painting was being admired by art enthusiasts from around the world. (Incorrect Sentence Structure)
(c) Art enthusiasts from around the world have admired the painting. (Incorrect Tense)
(d) The painting has been admired by art enthusiasts from around the world. (Incorrect Sentence Structure)

question:
Select the most appropriate idiom that can substitute the underlined words in the given sentence.
Its Christmas and everything looks so beautiful. It makes me believe that life is wonderful and pleasant.
solution: (c) Bowl of cherries- wonderful and pleasant.

question:
Select the word which means the same as the group of words given.
The science or philosophy of law
solution:
(c) jurisprudence- The science or philosophy of law
(a) Justice -just behaviour or treatment.
(b) infirmary- a place in a large institution for the care of those who are ill.
(d) archive -a collection of historical documents or records providing information about a place, institution, or group of people.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.
A person who is a lover of women.
solution:
(d) Philogynist- a person who is a lover of women.
Monogamist- a person who is in a relationship with only one partner at a time.
Misogynist- a man who hates women
Philologist- who specializes in the study of language in oral and written historical sources

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
(A) The main objective was to have complete learning and realising one's inner potential.
(B) Students lived away from their homes for years together till they achieved their goals.
(C ) During that period, the gurus and their shishyas lived together in the Gurukul
(D) They helped each other in day-to-day life.
solution:
(b) CDAB
Sentence C will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. The period of gurukuls. And, Sentence D states the lifestyle of gurus and shishyas. So, D will follow C. Further, Sentence A states about their main objective & Sentence B states about the students . So, B will follow A. Going through the options, option (b) has the correct sequence.

question:
Select the most appropriate Synonym of the given word.
Probe
solution:
(b) Investigate
Investigate- to try to find out all the facts about something
Probe- to ask questions in order to find out secret or hidden information
Ignore- to pay no attention to somebody/something

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
The Magic Fountain is renowned for ______ spectacular light and music shows.
solution:
(a) its
It's is a contraction and should be used where a sentence normally reads "it is", the apostrophe(s) indicates that part of a word has been removed like It's raining is a contraction of It is raining. Whereas, Its with no apostrophe(s) is the possessive form of the pronoun it which means belonging to it like the dog hurt its tail. Similarly in the given sentence, spectacular light and music shows belong to the Magic Fountain. Hence, its is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Pick a word opposite in meaning to
Omit
solution:
(b) include
Omit- leave out or exclude, either intentionally or forgetfully.
Include- to contain something as a part of something else.
Exclude- deny access to a place, group, or privilege.
Undertake- commit oneself to and begin (an enterprise or responsibility); take on.
Add- means join (something) to something else so as to increase the size, number, or amount.

question:
Pick a word opposite in meaning to
Formidable obstacles have to be overcome before success is achieved.
solution:
(c) Safe
Formidable - inspiring fear or respect through being impressively large, powerful, intense, or capable.
Indomitable - impossible to subdue or defeat.
Facile - ignoring the true complexities of an issue; superficial.
Safe - protected from or not exposed to danger or risk; not likely to be harmed or lost
Invincible - too powerful to be defeated or overcome

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
The driver was_______ injured.He died within an hour.
solution: (b) Fatally - It means causing or ending in death.

question:
Cloze test:-
Pollution is destroying nature. The smoke that is (96) ______ from the chimneys of the factories, and from vehicles is the mixture of poisonous gases. Due to environmental pollution, there is (97) ______ in nature, so, many birds, animals, and plants are on the verge of (98) ______ day by day. The only way to (99) ______ environmental pollution is to plant many trees. By planting trees, we can get rid of many harmful poisonous gases. It is the responsibility of everyone to (100) ______ and protect our environment.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no. 96
solution: (d) Emit means to send out something, for example, a smell, a sound, smoke, heat or light. The given passage talks about the smoke that is emitted from the chimneys of the factories. Hence, emitted is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test:-
Pollution is destroying nature. The smoke that is (96) ______ from the chimneys of the factories, and from vehicles is the mixture of poisonous gases. Due to environmental pollution, there is (97) ______ in nature, so, many birds, animals, and plants are on the verge of (98) ______ day by day. The only way to (99) ______ environmental pollution is to plant many trees. By planting trees, we can get rid of many harmful poisonous gases. It is the responsibility of everyone to (100) ______ and protect our environment.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no. 97
solution: (a) Imbalance means a difference or not being equal. The given passage states that there is an imbalance in nature due to environmental pollution. Hence, an imbalance is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test:-
Pollution is destroying nature. The smoke that is (96) ______ from the chimneys of the factories, and from vehicles is the mixture of poisonous gases. Due to environmental pollution, there is (97) ______ in nature, so, many birds, animals, and plants are on the verge of (98) ______ day by day. The only way to (99) ______ environmental pollution is to plant many trees. By planting trees, we can get rid of many harmful poisonous gases. It is the responsibility of everyone to (100) ______ and protect our environment.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no. 98
solution: (d) Extinction means a situation in which something no longer exists. The given passage states that so, many birds, animals, and plants are on the verge of extinction day by day. Hence, extinction is the most appropriate answer

question:
Cloze test:-
Pollution is destroying nature. The smoke that is (96) ______ from the chimneys of the factories, and from vehicles is the mixture of poisonous gases. Due to environmental pollution, there is (97) ______ in nature, so, many birds, animals, and plants are on the verge of (98) ______ day by day. The only way to (99) ______ environmental pollution is to plant many trees. By planting trees, we can get rid of many harmful poisonous gases. It is the responsibility of everyone to (100) ______ and protect our environment.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no. 99
solution: (a) Eradicate means to destroy or get rid of something completely. The given passage states that the only way to eradicate environmental pollution is to plant many trees. Hence, eradicate is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test:-
Pollution is destroying nature. The smoke that is (96) ______ from the chimneys of the factories, and from vehicles is the mixture of poisonous gases. Due to environmental pollution, there is (97) ______ in nature, so, many birds, animals, and plants are on the verge of (98) ______ day by day. The only way to (99) ______ environmental pollution is to plant many trees. By planting trees, we can get rid of many harmful poisonous gases. It is the responsibility of everyone to (100) ______ and protect our environment.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no. 100
solution: (b) Preserve means to keep something safe or in good condition. The given passage states that it is the responsibility of everyone to preserve and protect our environment. Hence, preserve is the most appropriate answer.
